name: Catalonia Bavaro Beach, Casino & Golf Resort

reviews.text: This was the best place i have ever been too. Being a flight attendant and having travelled the world. I have seen many places and beaches all through the carribbean and mexico and I have stayed at 5 stars and i must be honest, this resort was rated a 4.5 and it could have easily been a 5star. The food was great and the beach was a 6star.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Have fun and have no hesitations. Be happy and have a great vacation.
reviews.title: Okay for the price.

likes.disliked: — Small older rooms and food quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Penny from Calgary
reviews.title: Good but not exceptional

likes.liked: — The cost was very affordable and the resort grounds were well maintained
likes.disliked: — The food and drinks were not up to par with other all inclusives we have been to

reviews.text: We stayed at this resort from Jan. 10 - 17 /08. After having read the reviews previous to booking, I was pretty well expecting the type of quality of resort it was for the amount we paid per person.
reviews.title: Nice resort, poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's about a 31/2 star by Canadian standards.
reviews.title: A little bit of heaven

likes.liked: — So clean and green, the white sand and blue water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ONE WEEK IN PARADISE – From Winnipeg to Catalonia
reviews.title: One Week in Paradise

reviews.text: Just returned from one week in Paradise (Jan. 02 – 09)! This is the third time my husband and I have been to Punta Cana and the Catalonia Resort is, in our estimation, by far the best one. We have never submitted a review, but enjoyed this time around so much, that we just had to. There was only one glitch that occurred - on our way in from the airport – our bus had a flat tire 2 minutes from the hotel and in the pitch dark!! – was fixed as quickly as possible (Dominican time that is) and we took it all in good stride! When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by an absolutely stunning hotel – all the Christmas decorations were still up, and even when they were packed away (day before we left to return home) the place was still stunning. The photos on the web-site, unfortunately (sorry about this) do not do the place justice – far far more beautiful than shown. So here is our review, and I will get the tipping part out of the way first as this may offend some.
reviews.title: Great Time

likes.disliked: — never got any messages left on phone / phones didnt work properly

reviews.text: Tipping – Even though tipping is not necessary, we have always tipped. The service industry is not the highest paying, with wages in the D.R. being quite low. Long hours are put in every day by the staff – i.e. the main buffet hostess we had, also hostessed at different restaurants on the resort. We wanted to tip her on our last day there (sort of a one shot tip) but she was not there, and I felt sad about that - will know for next time. I look at it this way – what is a couple of hundred dollars to most of us for tipping for the week. Housekeeping we tipped $3.00 per day per person (at this resort we only had one housekeeper for our room), $1.00 for each omelet, and $1.00 for each drink consumed. At the end of the stay we also left for our housekeeper little extras we brought – hand lotions, body lotions, etc. The tips are appreciated by all the staff, and it was just a way for us to say ‘thank you’ for making each day at the resort extra special.
reviews.title: Beautiful but problems

likes.liked: — beach and friendliness of the staff

reviews.text: Hotel Front Desk Staff – very professional, courteous, and definitely aim to please.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms – our room was situated on the beach (we called Nolitours as soon as we booked on-line, and requested beach front – and they came through for us completely). We had an amazing view of the ocean with the pool in front of us. Our room was situated on the third floor, corner suite. Therefore we were graced with 3 windows (the main sliding doors), window in the ‘living room’ area, and also a window in the very very large round tub, closet (nice and large), and large sink area room. So lots of light. The shower and toilet was in its own room. Lots of hot water for showering – never ran out no matter what time of day. The suite contained a small bar fridge – always kept filled with beer, soft drinks and bottled water, sofa, chair, a few tables, and dresser, along with a super king size bed. Lots of room to move around in – never felt cramped at all. The balcony was a great size – drying rack, lounge chair, wee table and hammock, with lots of room to spare. My husband completely relaxed in the hammock!
reviews.title: happy christmas on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at several all-inclusive resorts in the Caribbean and this one was really one of the best.
reviews.title: Don't Hesitate-- Book it!!

reviews.text: Food - lots of variety, always available, and delicious.
reviews.title: Resort has it's problems

likes.disliked: — Pool snack bar - terrible, terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms - gorgeous, spacious and very clean. The huge luxurious bathtub was especially a treat.
reviews.title: Guests Beware

reviews.text: Beach - GORGEOUS! White sand, lined with tall palm trees.
reviews.title: OK Resort
The truth: Pleasant surprise
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week long stay at the Catalonia Bavaro Resort. We travelled with two teenagers from the west coast of Canada (8 hour flight). Before booking this resort, we read many review from this site - they were mixed so we felt like we were taking a chance. We have lots of experiences at all-inclusive resorts (7 resorts) in Mexico (all 4.5 star and 5 star) so we have plenty to compare this one to. This was our first trip to the DR and we were nervous.
FLIGHT: long but this has nothing to do with the resort.
reviews.title: Our Awesome Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DR AIRPORT: arrived on time. Given very little direction once off the plane as to where to proceed. Basically forced to have your photograph taken before you can enter the airport building. Very windy. Waited in a hot and humid area for luggage to tumble on to an inefficient conveyor belt (keep a close eye because luggage fell off easily). Once you gather your belongings, you start to head for next section and all of sudden you are accosted by locals who want to carry your luggage (they expect tips and will not take "no" for an answer). Tip: hold on to your luggage, don't let go, say "no gracious", have your hotel reservation documents ready, proceed to your tour provider's kiosk and get the bus number that will take you to your resort - proceed quickly through the locals that want to take your luggage 50 feet or so to your bus. Once you get to your bus, watch and make sure that your luggage is placed in the lower part of the bus. Show your hotel reservation documents to the rep and off you go onto the bus.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: BUS RIDE: air-conditioned bus. Not a bumpy ride as others have said. It is a 15 to 20 minute ride to the resort.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time! - met some great people!

likes.disliked: — Can't access all rooms in building from one entrance - kids were on other side.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ARRIVAL: leave your luggage to be removed by the hotel staff and proceed directly to the lobby desk. Again, have your hotel reservation documents and ID ready. There is then a strange three step procedure: (a) reception representative checks documents and ID (make sure all members of your party are present there at the desk whe you do this; (b) move to your right and obtain the "all-inclusive" bracelet and then go get your luggage; and (c) stay in the lobby area with your luggage [one or two could go get drinks for all from the lobby bar] and eventually they will start to call out names and pass out plastic envelopes/pouches with your room number, one room key, 4 ala carte reservations, 2 towel cards and a map. You can leave your luggage with a porter to bring to your room or, as we did, just carry your stuff to your room. Rooms are numbered with the first number being your Villa. Example: 102 is room #2 in Villa 1. Tip: just ask one of the porters to point you in the direction of your room - there are signs and rooms are easy to find. We were right at the beach which is the farthest from the lobby - great rooms! Once you check out your room and you like it, or find it acceptable, go back to the lobby and they will make another key (or 2 or 3). That is the procedure.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings
will be coming back
reviews.text: All in all it was a great week and we would definately recommend the Catalonia Bavaro Beach Resort.

Catalonia Bavaro is a great, beautiful, and very clean resort. Although the staff speaks mainly Spanish, they are very friendly. There is a wide variety of food. The buffet is excellent (grilled meat, lobster, chicken, seafood, paella). We miss the daily breakfast at Catalonia. Don't forget to try the pizzas at the snack bar near the nice swimming pool. The pizzas brought back memories of delicious tuna pizzas that we have had in Southern France. The room that we had was pretty clean. Although seaweeds appear at the end of the day depending on the weather, the staff cleans up many times on a daily basis. The water is clear. My husband saw many colored fish, octopus, lobster amongst others. It could be a good thing to reserve long chairs around ten to seven if you prefer a shady place; otherwise, there were plenty of spots. I thought it was unacceptable to stand people smoking beside pregnant women and kids during the shows in the evening. The resort needs to work on it. Despite this one drawback, we fully recommend this resort.
reviews.title: wonderful vacation

reviews.text: A group of 6 of us travelled to this hotel with Nolitours. First off, let me say that Nolitours turned out to be a pretty great tour operator. I had heard some horror stories about them in past (even from my parents) but they were great for us. Very friendly and informative tour rep. Also, one of us lost our luggage upon arrival (great way to start a vacation for a first timer) and thankfully through the diligent work of the Nolitours staff, my friend had her luggage back in her hands that same evening!! We also flew with Air Transat, and even though my personal experience with them in the past has be horrible, this time everything was on time.
reviews.title: Great hotel for relaxation, but nothing too spectacular
Wasted Time and Money
reviews.text: For the resort itself I find it easiest to breakdown into sections.

The Hotel Itself/Grounds - Very clean, and well maintained. Beautifully kept grounds, and friendly staff. As many others have said, the language barrier is a bit difficult, but just be friendly and patient, and they will try their best to accomadate you. The layout was excellent in my opinion. The Lobby, Casino, Shops, Main Restaurant, Stage and Disco were all located in the one centralized area, which made it easy to go from one spot to the next without having to walk a great deal to get somewhere. I find some resorts when they are overly spread out is a bit of a nuisance. All the rooms are located on your way to the beach from the above activity areas. About a 5 min walk. The pool is right by the beach, which was nice to get the breeze off the ocean, and there is also another small restaurant by the pool. Some people have said the water in the pool was cold. I personally did not have a problem with it. A little frigged to begin with, but once you are in, it's fine. For me I prefer to be re-freshed then be swimming in something that feels like bathwater, but that's just me. The pool was very clean though.
reviews.title: Back in a Heartbeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach - Not the nicest beach I've seen (especially for Punta Cana). There was quite a bit of seaweed, but they did try and keep it as clean as possible by combing it each morning. The water itself was beautiful though, great temperature and fairly calm. If you go to the right once you are on the beach past the Bavero Royal and up a little walkway there are some vendors there. Friendly people and good prices. Most are willing to barter, and if they are being difficult then just move on, you'll likely find the exact same thing in the next shop.
reviews.title: A great place with a fabulous staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed at the Cataonia from June 18th-25th for our honeymoon, having been switched there at the last minute due to construction at our previously booked resort. We didn't regret it one bit! Upon arrival, the front desk was a little slower than we would have liked, but we found that this is the pace in the DR. My advice? Take the opportunity during the wait for your room to head to the lounge for a Coco Loco! Or pack your bathing suit in your carry-on so you can wait for your room at the beach. From day one, the service was impeccable, the room we stayed in (328) was spotlessly cleaned every day, and the air conditioning worked almost too well. The buffet restaurants are both great, the food was always fresh and the staff was always friendly and quick with the service. They remembered our names from the first day, and it helps to tip a couple of dollars when the service is great...they remember those who treat them well. Specifically look for Alli (Eulalia) and tell her Doug & Laura sent you! The beach was beautiful, white powdered sand, and the ocean floor was vaccuumed and the beach raked at least 3 times a day! Crystal clear waters, too! I've never been a pool person, but the pool at the Catalonia changed that...it's huge, extremely clean, and very comfortable. Not once did we have problems finding a beach chair, either at the pool or the beach, and we rarely got to either before 1pm. The entertainment was absolutely wonderful, and there are tons of things to do, so you won't have to worry about being bored, ever! There is a small shopping mall on the resort, with a pharmacy, a mini-market, jewellery store, spa services, a gym, a tobacco shop, and the best women's clothing store I have ever been in, even compared to Vancouver. Very good prices on everything, we found...the prices were definitely fair. The only thing I would not recommend purchasing at the shops would be sunblock ($14US) or mosquito repellant (same). As far as anything else, you won't pay through the nose for any of it. We bought milk to keep in our mini-bar for $2US. One thing, if you do walk down the beach off resort property, be prepared to be drawn in by the vendors...they are VERY persistent! And although you may think you're a great barterer and getting a good deal, you aren't. We bought a painting which although is very nice, we saw at the Punta Cana airport on the way home for half the price we paid. My advice...stay on the resort for shopping, you won't regret it. We did one excursion, the Marinarium to snorkel with nurse sharks and stingrays. I would definitely recommend this one, it's a half day excursion which ends with a swim in a lagoon on a sandbar where the water is waist-deep and crystal clear, and the bartender serves your drinks in the water. But BRING YOUR SUNBLOCK!!! I didn't, and I suffered for it later! Internet is available in the lobby area for $3US for 15 minutes, although the keyboards are in Spanish, so a little different to use...just ask the staff to switch it to English for you.
reviews.title: Best resort Ever!

likes.liked: — The staff, the cleanliness, the pool, the entertainment and the food!
likes.disliked: — The slower than I was used to front desk staff, but the pace is slower here too, so to be expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I would very definitely recommend this resort to anyone thinking about visiting the DR...we made plans before we even left to return within the next 6-12 months, it was that great! We had thought about trying out other resorts every time we return, but have decided that the bar was raised pretty high at the Catalonia....we think that anywhere else would be a letdown now!
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking forward to our return trip!
reviews.title: Best Vacation (Recommend to EVERYONE)

reviews.text: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Catalonia Bavaro and would go back there again.
reviews.title: Reconsider your trip.

likes.liked: — Food was amazing. Plus they had four a la cartes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Rooms: The room (a king suite) was of a much higher standard than other similar-priced AI resorts, with a full variety of furnishings and fittings. It was a good size with a separate sitting area. The big round bathtub was wonderful for relaxing in at the end of the day. We loved the hammock and rocking chair on the balcony (which I've never seen at an AI before). The fridge was well stocked with water, a variety of soda, and beer. Other pluses: the safe was free to use, there was a coffee maker, the TV remote was there and working
reviews.title: Loved the excursions

likes.liked: — The huge bathtub and spanish T.V.
likes.disliked: — The room was a little dark.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Catalonia Bavaro Resort from June 22 - 27 and we were very disappointed with quite a few things.
reviews.title: Caution travelers for Catalonia

reviews.text: Room - we stayed in building 23, 3rd floor, halfway between lobby and pool, good location. Clean room overall and nice size with sitting area (what was included in pkg) but there were problems. No towels when we got there so we called. Didn't deliver so we found the laudrymat next door and got some from them. Same thing the next day, no towels but they brought some later. No face cloths at all but they give you sponges. First nite toilet was continually leaking but they fixed it the next morning. No hot water every afternoon from 2-5 so you had to wait to take a shower unless of course you wanted to freeze. TV went off the day before we left and didn't come back on until late that nite - same for everyone there. A/C in room ok but could have been cooler. Blow dryer in bathroom would have taken an hour to dry my hair so I used mine. Blew the circuit out every single time and that was just with the tv on, no lights. Managed to get it dry tho. Keys to our room didn't work one day so we had to walk to the lobby and get new ones. We talked to another couple there (they will also write a review) and they had similar problems as ours, even the key thing. Beds of course are hard but that happens most places - we took a blanket and put underneath the sheet which helped. They have a huge spa tub in the bathroom that we were going to fill. It would have taken 5 days just to get it up to the halfway mark so forget that.
reviews.title: An Honest British Opinion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food - now this was the disappointment - buffets were not good. I cannot believe that anyone could eat that food in the other reviews. It was amazing how they could take veggies and turn them into something that nobody could recognize and taste horrible. The one good items were the roasted chicken and fried chicken however my husband got 3 pieces and all were still bloody - didn't eat them of course and even the waiter went ewwww. Even the breakfast had limited food and they put salad and carrots out as a filler, we laughed. The nice thing was you could make reservations for the ala carte restaurants instead of waiting in line in the mornings to get a reservation. Ate at the Rodeo Steak House and the steak was tender (better than the buffets that were like leather) but just a little overdone. Mariachi, Mexican restaurant was our fave. We would have eaten there every nite had we known. La Toscana, Italian - tried 3 different entrees, just OK. There is a place by the pool called Snack Bar Pleamar and unfortunately we didn't try that until the last day - GREAT pizza!!!! I would have lived on that had I known. Heard from another couple the Japanese was not good so glad we didn't try that one.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but felt isolated from Domenican culture

likes.disliked: — The isolation from other hotels or a near by city/village.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool and Beach - Pool is nice and large but just no breeze at all due to where it is located. Beach is gorgeous and huge! There are plenty of palapas however you do need to get out there by 9 a.m. to reserve one, even tho they say you can't, cause they will be taken. Plenty of palm trees tho for shade also. Went to the bathroom by the pool and they had shut the water off so had to wash the soap off my hand in the pool - I think they have a water problem at this resort obviously.
reviews.title: A for effort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service - well, it was ok. Most were friendly but some sure weren't. My husband likes club soda but from the tap is flat and they would not give him a small bottle of it, which they had plenty sitting there for alcoholic drinks. It was like he was robbing their bar. Heck, he's not even drinking liquor.
reviews.title: Not what I expected

likes.disliked: — Lack of activities and maid service/room cleanliness

reviews.text: The beach is absolutely gorgeous. It was exactly what the doctor ordered for relaxing. Don't pay for the Royal section as their beach was pathetic in comparison. The lounges were comfortable and plentiful. Palapas were generally taken by 9:00am. There is some seaweed, but they were constantly cleaning it up while we were there and didn't affect the use of the beach. There were no vendors on the beach trying to sell anything, but if you walked either way down the beach from the resort, there were a few local shops where you could barter (settle for around 1/3 of the original price asked!). The shops to the right as you face the water were better.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

likes.disliked: — That it was far from other hotels, shopping, population

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: MY husband and I were at this resort Jan 17-24. With alot of research on the different resorts in Punta Cana, we decided to go with this one for many different but one important reason..The reason is and the main reason was it had a bit of everything to offer especially GOLF. <My hubbie is addicted to golf and for me all i was interested in was a fab beach. Oh yes, not to mention the price was right as well!!
reviews.title: Rain or Sun..still alot of fun!!

likes.liked: — the fact the resort was clean

reviews.text: We had a great flight from toronto. We left the cold and the best feeling ever was walking out of the plane in Punta Cana to feel the warmth. Got through the airport smoothly and off we were to find the bus to take us to the resort. That had to be the most confusing thing ever, We were told atleast 3 different numbers for the buses and they are all numbered. Each bus for eachresort. Finally we got to the bus and went on. All the other buses were leaving and there we were sitting there with no idea as to why we have not left. Long story short...I still dont know to this day,but lets jsut say it took much longer then it should have. Finally we were on our way. Its a very short bus ride to the resort. Upon arrival to this resort I was completely impressed with the open, bright lobby! We checked in and within 10 minutes we got our keys to our room. The staff took our bags and placed them into the cart. I WAS SHOCKED that they took our bags, but hey what about us? Where is our room? Oh yes, one thing I did not like was the fact we had to attempt to find our room on our own. It was interesting to find our villa as I forgot to m ention that we arrived late night. The resort is brightly lit, however if u dont know where u r going, it can be a fraustrating why to start off. FINALLY got to our room 3127. Walked in and once again I was shocked to see the state of the room...one word to explain the room...PERFECT! Very bright,large and most importuntly CLEAN! The shower and the toilet where in the same room, and the 2 sitter bathtub was on the otherside from where the shower was. I was super excited to see how nice the rooms were as the other half and I have had some horrible experiences in the past. We decided to drop our things and make our way through the resort to see whats where and find something to eat. No problems, th hubbie found some hotdogs and we then found the casino. Lets just say we were not so lucky to win anything.
reviews.title: Awesomeeee time!

likes.liked: — close to the airport, clean, friendly staff, awesome food,

reviews.title: Two weeks of pure joy and fun! A job well done by all, Thanks Jesus.
reviews.text: To get to the point of my thoughts of this resort, I will list everything good and bad briefly:

reviews.title: Lovely Place - Great for Families with KIDS

likes.liked: — big nice rooms with safe that was included in the price :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Clean and spacious rooms
reviews.title: Awsome Resort
Loved this resort
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful week at the Catalonia Resort. The weather was around 85 degrees. The food was excellent (4 a la carte restaurant and a crepe a la carte). The food in the main buffet was excellent and a very good variety of food. They had lobster and filet for Xmas Eve among other wonderful food. Another night they had crab plus a selective of other things. The snack area by the pool had excellent pizza, hamburgs, hot dogs and chicken.

reviews.title: Great holiday
reviews.text: The rooms were very spacious -king bed, sitting area, etc. Bathroom with a tub for two, separate room with shower and toilet.

reviews.title: Mixed Experience - I'd try somewhere else
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly. The landscaping and grounds are very well maintained. The entertainment was a different production every night (Grease, etc. etc.) and was wonderful. Live band also every night.

reviews.title: Great time
reviews.text: I would not hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone.

reviews.title: It's in the Eye of the Beholder
reviews.text: The grounds were very nice, there was a tropical storm the first week and the ocean turned up quite a bit, but staff cleaned the beach daily. The pool is beautiful and alot of fun. Activities are in abundance, from snorkelling to ATV's (which we recommend). There is shopping in the resort as well as a short walk to some venders on the beach.
The restaurants were very good and even my picky eaters enjoyed the food! I highly recommend trying all the restaurants!
reviews.title: Catalonia in the Fall

reviews.text: I was a little worried after seeing some pictures about cleanliness. However, I did not see this. But I suppose if you're looking to have a bad experience you'll take up close pictures of whatever proves your point. (and might I add... this IS a third world country... everything is different, and not the same standards! its part of the experience - maybe, be humbled and grateful!)
reviews.title: The Second Time was Good, but...

likes.disliked: — The staff sometimes wasn't too attentive.

reviews.text: If I was going to say anything negative it would be; the resort is away from populated areas - so, you will have to travel to see anything else.
reviews.title: Got Married Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Catalonia Bavaro April 20-27. For the most part I'd say it was pretty great. There were some cons but I felt that there were more pros.
reviews.title: Great time, I would recommend it!

likes.liked: — The animation staff. They were very fun :)
likes.disliked: — Some of the service from the main desk. We had to ask more than once to have things fixed.

reviews.text: First off, the resort as a whole is gorgeous. It's also very big. Everything seems to be kept very nice and neat, I often saw people working and cleaning throughout our stay. The large size of the resort is good and bad. I really recommend that people try to get rooms closer to the beach and pool. If you get a room closer to reception, it's quite a walk to get to the beach and pool area.
reviews.title: Burn Baby Burn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 3 tennis courts and a basketball court. They are all very good. We used the tennis and basketball and they were great. The golf course looked beautiful as well, though we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Looooooooooooooooooooooooooooved it :)

reviews.text: The staff was amazing. They were so happy and had a LOT of energy. The people at the reception area didn't seem as excited by their jobs, but they weren't rude, just not as enthusiastic :)
reviews.title: Beautiful, Great time...I'll be back for sure!

reviews.text: The rooms are nice and clean. Every room has a little balcony which is nice. The only problems were our phone and remote for the tv didn't work. We had to ask a few times before we finally got them working again, which was a little annoying, but not a huge deal.
reviews.title: Great place not so good service

reviews.text: My husband and I took our baby son on his first beach holiday and choose this resort because it looked good on photos and it wasn't the most expensive nor the cheapest.
reviews.title: Too bad...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were very pleased with the check-in because they gave us a room on the ground floor (which is much more confortable to handle baby gear) and it was near the pool.
reviews.title: A fabulous week spent in paradise!

reviews.text: the rooms are old and ugly. the shower is more than old, with those curtain and stick to your legs and are anything but hyginic. there was never enough water pressure for a nice long shower. but there is a big tub in a corner of the bathroom.
reviews.title: Amazing trip lovely beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: so far we could handle it. on the third day we saw 2 roaches on our room! my husband killed them and in the morning we phoned the reception. after one hour they sent someone over to kill the roaches!!! it took several phone calls to explain that we did not want those roaches killed, we wanted a roach free room... then they sent someone to spray the room, with us there. we refused because we had the baby there and baby clothes and baby food and the products used are toxic. finally we were moved to a diferent room and though i'm not sure it didn't have roaches, at least we didn't see them.
reviews.title: Great for a relaxing getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: when we laid down to finally rest after one day less at the beach, we found out that one of the legs of the bed was broken! we hardly managed to sleep at all.
reviews.title: I loved everything about it! Want to move there!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just got back to Canada after an amazing, hot and beautiful one week trip to Punta Cana. Our Skyservice flight from Pearson was great as was the arrival into Punta Cana airport. It was very well organized (and airconditioned) when we arrived, and had little to no confusion as to where to go. Once we passed customs we went into a room to find out travel company (ours was nolitours) and they told us which bus to go onto to get to the Catalonia Bavaro.
reviews.title: If you like Pina Coladas...

likes.disliked: — Prices of excersions, hours of buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving up to the resort after only 10min on the bus was great! I could not believe how fabulous it looked. It was all lit up as it was 9:30pm when we got there. There were vendors selling things in the lobby which only happens on Friday nights there. It is convinient for those travelers who don't plan on leaving the resort to shop.
reviews.title: Good times at Catalonia Bavaro :)

reviews.text: We stayed in Villa 27 which was between the beach and main lobby so we didn't have a far way to walk to either! The room was clean but could use for some updating in the next little while. The first day we didn't think we had hot water but turns out we were turning the tap the wrong way! Sounds stupid, but it was opposite (towards the blue is hot and red is cold). So we found out the hard way....We had no water on the 4th day and so we went to customer service and they fixed it while we were at lunch! The TV was nice to watch before bed and it had so many english channels! About 100 channels in total and we found over 20 to be english (and they played good movies!). The blow dryer was great and always hot! The bathtub was the best, it was a two person one and actually filled up fast. One night i timed it at about 15min and it was soooo hot, which was great. No clock in the room though so bring an alarm clock or cellphone to get you up in time for excursions etc. Beds were very comfy compared to previous ones in Cuba. Although the pillows were terrible so bring your own! And finally, small bugs in the room but that was expected. They were almost impossible to see and they were only on the floors so we didn't mind. How often are you in your room on vacation anyways?
reviews.title: This was our Worst Holiday. Never going back to Punta Cana!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a problem with our key not working once and it was because we put it with our camera. It is magnet and so is the camera so the reception desk told us this would deactivate the room key. It took about 5 seconds to re-activate it...not a problem at all!!
reviews.title: Awesome! Totally Awesome!

reviews.text: The food was great here, no major complaints. however the buffet was open for breakfast at 6:30- 10 and lunch from 12:30-3. I found this to be awkward because my boyfriend and I wanted to eat around 10:30- 11 and we really couldn't. Crepes were awsome!! We had so many over the course of the week. I recommend the apple and chocolate ones. The a la carte restaurants were clean and had very fast service! No waiting, no lines, no problems. Sometimes the food was overcooked but i'd rather that then have it raw. I wasn't about to let that ruin our vacation. Both my boyfriend and I would recommend the pasta at lunch and dinner in the buffet, it was made to order and very very tasty.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.text: We just came back from a 7 day stay at the Catalonia Bavaro resort . Overall, the trip was great, partially due to the company that we were in.
reviews.title: Combination of the bad and the good

reviews.text: - Nice resort, could use some colours
reviews.title: Who could ask for anything more????

reviews.text: - Service was not consistent, some people were very friendly while others seem to prefer spanish-speaking tourists more
reviews.title: Still a Great Place

likes.liked: — the rooms are large and spacious with a balcony and a hammock the tub is great
likes.disliked: — not enough hot water at times

reviews.text: - Room was nice but too many bugs... we came back with ALOT of ant bites
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: In all of the buffet restaurants there are beer and soda taps that you can help youself too, so you don't even have to ask if you want to get a beer! I loved this so much. I would suggest bringing a thermos or your own large cup to drink out of as the cups they have are quite small. Some of the mixed drinks were weird, but once I found a couple that I liked I stuck to those. The Blue Hawaiian was my favorite, but sometimes they don't put rum in it unless you ask. So make sure you say "with rum" when you order it.
reviews.title: mui bien

likes.liked: — food / beach / pool / some of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was the only part of the trip that was less than perfect, which is why I gave this resort 4 out of 5. I think they have almost too much selection in the buffets, making it a little bit "quantity over quality". I am a vegetarian and most of the non-meat options were average, but again, once I found a few awesome things I was set. The pizza at the pool is awesome, the omelette station is great (and they will make regular eggs fresh for you too), and all of the salads are yummy too. If you are a meat eater I'm sure you'll have no problem finding a whole bunch of great foods. There were a lot of europeans there, which makes me feel like the food was more catered to that style over the north american style I am used to.
reviews.title: Loved Everything abotu the Catalonia Bavaro

reviews.text: A la carte restaurants were good, but not excellent. The Italian was good, and the Teppanyakki (they cook in front of you) Japanese was great. Mexican was pretty average. I didn't try the steak house since I don't eat meat :)
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely week in the low season in late December just before the Xmas rush. Enjoyable, but we will not be going back to this hotel... too many other great places to visit and no big enough 'wow' factor to encourage a 2nd stay.
reviews.title: Noisy but beautiful

likes.liked: — pool, beach and warm temperatures and a lovely room
likes.disliked: — noise, undrinkable wine and so-so food

reviews.text: Perfectly acceptable junior suite, room 301, on the ground floor not far from the beautiful and very large pool, postcard perfect beach and tropical gardens.
reviews.title: Fantastic vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 750 some rooms at the Catalonia so this is a BIG resort and we were lucky to be there on a 'slow' week just before the holidays.
reviews.title: Great Vacation
Just got back, You have to go here!
reviews.text: Good points:

reviews.title: Good Value For The Money
reviews.text: -the pool is large and warm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trip Advisor Report: Catalonia Bavaro Resort Dec. 1st – 8th 2007
reviews.title: Hey Sauri, two white russians, por favor :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-In:
reviews.title: Impressed with the details and the beauty

likes.liked: — beach, pool, beach restaurant, suites, beautiful gardens and waterways
likes.disliked: — toliets (not enough around pool and beach); no beach drink service or premium alcohol selection

reviews.text: I found it a bit on the sluggish side. We arrived at the hotel at about 1pm and didn’t get our room assignment until after 3pm – however, we were quickly sorted out with the magical green arm band that were the keys to the city… an sauntered over to the lobby bar for a few cold cocktails.
reviews.title: Helluva Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Guest Rooms:
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.disliked: — took forever to fill the double tub it was so huge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We requested a third floor room near the Pool Bar, and wound up on the first floor. I was hopping for a view of the ocean, but really don’t think many if any rooms have a clear view of the ocean. We were in villa 18 on the ground floor and I was really happy with the location. It was extremely close to the Pool Bar where we spent the majority of our time. We are morning people, and hit the beach first thing in the morning. It was a fair hike up the cobble stoned paths to the Grand Caribe Buffet, but it was scenic and rather enjoyable. Coffee in the room was a great start to the day, coffee in the Grand Caribe Buffet was harsh. D.R. coffee is extremely strong. I’m a coffee drinker, and I could only handle one full cup at the buffet in the morning.
reviews.title: Amazing Resort

reviews.text: We stayed at this resort from Feb. 22, 2007 until March 1, 2007. I agree with a lot of what others have said about the resort.
reviews.title: Warning to Travelers

reviews.text: The meals were ho-hum; we loved the beach but hated the fact that we had to rise before dawn to secure 8 lounges together
reviews.title: Awesome Resort!!

likes.liked: — The grounds, beach, pool and the staff, casino and the restaurants.
likes.disliked: — The seaweed was close in the ocean, so you didnt have much room to relax in the water.

reviews.text: under a palapa; the weather was wonderful; the ocean was clear; the room was great as was the maid service.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My one huge complaint is that when my brother back in the states contracted viral encephalitis and my sister-in-law tried to reach me, the resort did not get the message to me. My daughter called the 2nd day & was promised by someone at the front desk that they would get the message to me. It never happen! Finally on the 3rd day my daughter happened to call while I was in the room and told me what happened. Thank God that he was out of the woods by the time she called. He was still in guarded condition so I wanted to speak to him & my sister-in-law to assure myself that he was going to be OK. I tried to call from the room but was unable to do so. We went to the front desk to complain and were offered no help regarding the phone other than we could go buy a phone card. The man said he was sorry (his sorry didn't sound very sincere!) but did not respond as one would have hoped in such an emergency situation.
reviews.title: Great vacation at the Catalonia Bavaro

likes.liked: — Very clean, large and a beautiful bath

reviews.text: The icing on the cake happened on the last day. We were going through all the literature regarding the resort; the blank stationery they leave for your use on the coffee table; etc. In the folder with the stationery was an unmarked envelope with the fax my sister-in-law sent me on the 1st day.
reviews.title: Paradise on Earth

likes.liked: — It has everything you could possibly ask for (Beach, Pool, Disco, Casino, Gold Course...) in one place.
likes.disliked: — Beach water has a lot of seaweed, despite the fact that it's constantly cleaned.

reviews.title: Fantastic Wedding!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: Stayed from May 30th to June 13th. Me and my new husband had a wonderful timw at the Catalonia along with our 48 guests!!

reviews.title: Beautiful Resort!
reviews.text: What a beautiful wedding!!!! we got married on the beach and it was just amazing!!!

The flight from Montreal was approx 4hrs. Check in was a breeze. Our wedding suite was amazing and all our family couldn't find anything to complain about for their rooms. all the villas are pretty much close to either the pool / beach or the main lobby / restaurants. But be prepared to do some walking.
reviews.title: Beautiful Catalonia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are just spectacular! The hotel grounds people work so hard to keep everything beautiful.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

likes.liked: — the beautiful hotel grounds and amazing white beach
likes.disliked: — enlish poorly catered for, food could be better but not that bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was great! Especially the steakhouse!! Great T-Bone steak, you have to have it. We ate at all the restaurants, nothing to complain about. Food was good and you can always find something you like at the buffets. And just to let you know, they serve Budwiser at the Steakhouse and Coronas at the Mexican... so don't forget to ask!!!!!!
reviews.title: Affordable and Wonderful!

likes.disliked: — Variety of food, bats and things to do close to hotel proximity

reviews.title: HATED IT
reviews.text: Okay, so I read another review from the same time frame in which I was there. I booked through cheap carribbean in advance as well...it was supposed to be a weekend with the girls. Our pick up at the aiport was delayed..then when we get to the hotel the guy at the desk takes our passports makes photocopies then proceeds to TELL US they are moving us to another hotel (comprable 5 star). We too were offered a massage and transport to the other hotel, and the ability to use both resorts amenities. We eventually agreed to goto the other hotel and are offered transportation to and from unlimited (we weren't going to pay a cab each time) ATV & massages. What we got was A TON of grief and aggravation for what was to be a short relaxing trip. The other hotel was smaller, cramped, fewer amenities, filled with unprofessional and inappropriate staff. (Globalia was the name of this resort) The list of problems we encountered were slow and sometimes non existent transportation, overcrowded pool and beach areas, the beach at the Globalia was dirty, nasty attitudes, inappropriate comments, canceled dinner reservations, no follow through on promised massages, attitude to spare and to add insult to injury THEFT. My cell phone was STOLEN FROM MY HOTEL ROOM ( I had no service it was plugged in to charge for my return home) I am still waiting for a response from the hotel as to what they plan to do. Overall I would say STAY AWAY FROM PUNTA CANA.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please take the negative reviews with a grain of salt.....My husband and I returned two weeks ago from an absolutely wonderful trip to the Catalonia Royal. We loved the service, the people, the facilities, all of it! The upgrade to the Royal Suites was worth it for the price we paid. It included a Royal room in a private section of the resort that is adults only, a private beach, pool and restaurant. The room included champagne and fruit basket at check in, robes/slippers, a DVD player, free coded safe and a beatiful layout. We had our own resaurant that served off a menu at lunch and required no reservations, a free massage, 24 hour room service. It was wonderful!
reviews.title: We had a PERFECT trip!

likes.disliked: — Pillows were a little hard - requested new ones.

reviews.text: We also had access to the main resort. We enjoyed the nightly shows, the casino and the disco. We ate at all of the restaurants. My husband is a chef and we own a restaurant, so we understood going in what to expect. The food wasn't great, but we always had plenty to eat. My favorite was the spiny back lobster at the Royal restaurant, Thallasa. All of the staff was wonderful and I would also reccommend the nine hole golf course.
reviews.title: YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!!!!!!!

likes.disliked: — The people who work there, especially Angel Juana.

reviews.title: WARNING!!!!!
reviews.text: We met many lovely people and had a truly great and well deserved week of R&R. We will definitely go back!

reviews.title: Beware!!
reviews.text: I can't believe that I just had the WORST vacation ever!!!!!!!! For the ones who were able to stay here, I'm sure it was great. But for me, I was told that there were no rooms for us, even though we booked this months in advance. The first guy at the counter wouldn't even speak to us so we asked for the manager. Maximo then came over and told us that we were going to stay at another resort for one day and then we would be back at the Catalonia the next day and have a VIP suite for the rest of our stay. He also said we would get a one hour massage each and an excursion each. He then walked away and 20 minutes later told us that we are going to stay at the other hotel for our whole trip. We asked what happened to the VIP suite, massages, etc... But all he said was, I don't know what you're talking about. Excuse me?!?! We tried to explain to him what he just said, but he refused to admit it. Then another guy came over, Jose Miguel de Jesus. He asked what the problem was and we tried to explain to him what just happened. All we got was, sorry but there are no rooms here for you. You will be staying at the other hotel 5 minutes away but can use the facilities at the Catalonia and we'll provide transportaion. We realized that it was useless to argue since we were in a forgein country and my Spanish is very limited. When we arrive at the other hotel, we realized we were down-graded. The place was no where as nice as the Catalonia. As soon as we checked and got our room, we decided to go back to the Catalonia. We found out that the Division Manager, Angel Juana was at our hotel so we waited for him. He said he would make sure to now give us 2 one hour massages each, whatever excursion we wanted, etc... But what happened was we got nothing. No massages. No excursions. Had to wait about an hour for transportation. Basically nothing but LIES!!!!! We even heard them give a free weeks stay to someone who had a dirty room. But they wouldn't even discuss the matter of restitution to us. I bet if they did give us a free week, I bet we would have gotten bumped. Because of this trip, I would never go back to Punta Cana. Go to a different place.

reviews.title: Very nice vacation
reviews.text: My husband and two teenage kids (16 & 17) stayed at the Catalonia from Jan 11 - 18.

The resort is impressive. The grounds and buildings are very lovely and the beach is amazing. Our room was very nice with a beautiful big bathroom, king size bed, living room and hammock on the balcony..nice touch. Mini fridge was well stocked with water and pop, but with a terrible tasting beer. We were in Villa 8. It is half way between the beach and the main areas. Noise levels at night were perfect. Anything closer and I think you would be bothered by the show noise.
reviews.title: I Don't Understand The Negative Reviews ...
Incredible Vacation Experience!
reviews.text: Check in needs to be changed. When we arrived, we handed in our hotel vouchers and they gave us our bracelet then we waited for the staff to put together EVERYONE'S "check in package" in a zippered bag. It contained your key, safe key, info and towel tickets. The problem was the language barrier. The staff member then gathers everyone around once all vochers are in and read aloud the names that belonged to each "check in package". Of course, he could not pronounce last names plus the accent, everyone was left scratching their heads wondering what was said. Why did they not just give you your package when you were in line handing in your hotel voucher like every other vacation resort I have been too?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was not the best. Somedays were better than others. I don't expect to be waited on hand and foot, but not having coffee served to me at breakfast, without waving like a fool at the staff, is unacceptable. The maid did a good job except for being inconsistant with towels and soap. I had my own towel so it didn't bother me too much. My advice is save a towel for the day you don't get one. The bars were always well staffed and you did not have to wait long for a beverage.
reviews.title: Excellent Catalonia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was edible and always had lots of choice, but there was no wow factor. The place to be is the a la carte. The four were fantastic. They exceeded my expectations. I had the best steak of my life at the Steak House Restaurant. Make sure you book them upon arrival or you will not get in.
reviews.title: Horrible!

reviews.text: Hi
reviews.title: Exceptional

likes.disliked: — the loud music in the pool

reviews.text: I was in Catalonia Bavaro Resort in Dez 2006 till january, the 1st.
reviews.title: Nice Ground, poor service

reviews.text: In one word, it was EXCELLENT!!! The food is ok, the staff ok, the animation group ok, the beach and the pool AMAZING!!!
reviews.title: Nice place

likes.liked: — The Royal was a new facility, very clean, quiet, relaxing, up scale.
likes.disliked: — The Catalonia needs updating, cleaning, painting, etc...

reviews.text: But... ( always a but........), the music on the pool is very, very loud.
reviews.title: Not as bad as some reviews! Mostly very nice.

reviews.text: We stayed in Catalonia for seven days and only thing we can say is:
reviews.title: Loved the hotels facilities and restaurants

reviews.text: the hotels facilities is very good
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort!, but he beach...not so much

reviews.title: Well worth the money

likes.liked: — the mini bar and the bath
likes.disliked: — Could have insect repellant in the room

reviews.title: Had a good time
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the resort from july 19 thur the 22, of this year. The weather was excellent, no rain. The food at the buffets were very good. They had lots to choose from. I liked them better than the resturants. The nightly shows were great. On the beach there were a lot of activity like sailing and kiaking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The empolyees were well manner and were generally helpful.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.text: The room was ok by carabean standards.I didnt like the bathroons. The shower was too small. The vanity in the bathroom had tiny little ants runing around. I liked the full refrig. in the room that contain all the bottle water and beer and soda.I rate this resort a full four stars. Will I go back again? Maybe ,because I like to go to different places.
reviews.title: Great, but not perfect

reviews.text: fter reading many comments on this site I was a little worried about certain aspects of this hotel. All I can say is there are a lot of sad people in the world who look for fault rather than trying to enjoy their holiday.
reviews.title: Terrible experience!!!!

likes.disliked: — bad service, bad food, dirty rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite simply the hotel is fantastic, the food is superb, the service is 5 star, the rooms are great and the wingers on this site should be locked up in a darkened room
reviews.title: Dining with the birds

description: A magnificent hotel resort with exclusive, white sandy beaches, crystalline Caribbean waters, palm trees lining the coast and abundant vegetation throughout the complex. Coral reefs along the beach allow guests to enjoy the rich marine life of the Caribbean Sea. It is located in Playa Bavaro (Punta Cana), one of the best beach areas in the Dominican Republic. The complex is situated 20 km from the International Airport of Punta Cana and 47 km from Higuey.
